list.item:
Do notÂ use the Prefilled Syringe if:
- it is cracked or damaged.
- the expiration (EXP) date has passed.

td.paragraph: 3a. Look at the Prefilled Syringe Body and check the liquid is clear and colorless to pale brown (seeÂ Figure C).

list.item: Do notÂ use the Prefilled Syringe if the liquid is wrong color, cloudy, or contains particles in it.
You may see air bubbles in the liquid. This is normal.

td.paragraph: 4a. Leave the Prefilled Syringe at room temperature 68Â°F to 77Â°F (20Â°C to 25Â°C) for 30 minutes to allow it to warm up (seeÂ Figure D).

list.item: Do notÂ warm the Prefilled Syringe using heat sources such as hot water or a microwave.

paragraph.content: 5. Choose an injection site (seeÂ Figure E).

td.paragraph: 5a.Â You may inject into:
- the front of your thighs.
- the stomach area (abdomen) except for the 2 inches around the belly button (navel).
- the outer area of the upper arm (caregiver only).

list.item: Do notÂ inject into skin that is within 2 inches of your belly button (navel), or is red, hard, tender, damaged, bruised, or scarred.
Do notÂ inject through your clothes.

td.paragraph: 5b. Rotate the injection site each time you give an injection.

list.item: Do not inject the same injection site each time you give an injection.
Each new injection site should be at least 1.2 inches away from the previous injection site.

td.paragraph: 6a. Wash your hands with soap and water and dry them thoroughly (seeÂ Figure F).

7a. Clean the injection site with an alcohol swab using a circular motion (seeÂ Figure G).
7b. Let the skin dry before injecting.

list.item: Do notÂ blow on or touch the injection site again before giving the injection.

td.paragraph: 8a. Hold the Prefilled Syringe by the injector body with the Cap on top using one hand. Gently pull the Cap straight off with the other hand.

list.item: Do notÂ pull back on plunger rod at any time.
Do notÂ remove the Cap until you are ready to inject.
Do not try to put the Cap back onto the Prefilled Syringe.
Do notÂ touch the Needle.

td.paragraph: 8b. Throw away (dispose of) the Cap in an FDA cleared sharps container (see Step 12 andÂ Figure H).

paragraph.content: 9. Insert the Prefilled Syringe into the injection site.

td.paragraph: 9a. Hold the Prefilled Syringe by its body in one hand between your thumb and index finger.
9b. Gently pinch a fold of skin at the injection site with one hand.
9c. With a quick and âdart-likeâ motion, insert the Needle completely into the fold of the skin at a 45-defree angle (seeÂ Figure I).

list.item: Do not change the position of the Prefilled Syringe after the injection has started.

td.paragraph: 10a. After the Needle is inserted, release the pinched skin.
10b. Push the Plunger down slowly and as far as it will go until the Prefilled Syringe is empty (See Figure J).

paragraph.content: 11. Remove the Prefilled Syringe from the injection site.

td.paragraph: 11a. Remove the Needle from your skin at the same angle it was inserted (seeÂ Figure K).

list.item: Do notÂ reuse the Prefilled Syringe.
Do not try to put the needle cover back on the Prefilled Syringe.
Do not touch the Needle.
Some bleeding may occur.
Do notÂ rub the injection site.

paragraph.content: 12. Throw away (dispose of) the Prefilled Syringe.

td.paragraph: 12a. Put the used Prefilled Syringe in an FDA-cleared sharps disposal container right away after use (seeÂ Figure L).

list.item: Do not try to put the Cap back onto the Prefilled Syringe.
Do notÂ throw away (dispose of) the Prefilled Syringe in your household trash.

If you do not have an FDA-cleared sharps disposal container, you may use a household container that is:
- made of a heavy-duty plastic,
- able to close with a tight-fitting, puncture-resistant lid, without sharps being able to come out,
- upright and stable during use,
- leak-resistant, and
- properly labeled to warn of hazardous waste inside the container.

When your sharps disposal container is almost full, you will need to follow your community guidelines for right way to disposal of it. There may be state or local laws about how you should throw away used needles and syringes. For more information about safe sharps disposal, and for specific information about sharps disposal in the state that you live in, go to the FDA's website at: http://www.fda.gov/safesharpsdisposal.
Do not dispose of your sharps disposal container in your household trash unless your community guidelines permit this. Do not recycle your used sharps disposal container.

td.paragraph: 13a. Treat the injection site by gently pressing a cotton ball or gauze to the site and apply an adhesive bandage, if necessary.

td.paragraph: 5b. Rotate the injection site each time you give an injection.

list.item: Do not injection the same injection site each time you five an injection.
Each new injection site should be at least 1.2 inches away from the previous injection site.

td.paragraph: 6a. Wash your hands with soap and water and dry them thoroughly (seeÂ Figure F).

7a. Clean the injection site with an alcohol swab (seeÂ Figure G).
7b. Let the skin dry before injecting.

list.item: Do notÂ blow on or touch the injection site again before giving the injection.

td.paragraph: 8a. Hold the Prefilled Syringe by the injector body with the Cap on top using one hand. Gently pull the Cap straight off with the other hand.

list.item: Do notÂ pull back on plunger rod at any time.
Do notÂ remove the Cap until you are ready to inject.
Do not try to put the Cap back onto the Prefilled Syringe.
Do notÂ touch the Needle.

td.paragraph: 8b. Throw away (dispose of) the Cap in an FDA cleared sharps container (see Step 12 andÂ Figure H).

paragraph.content: 9. Insert the Prefilled Syringe into the injection site.

td.paragraph: 9a. Hold the Prefilled Syringe by its body in one hand between your thumb and index finger.
9b. Gently pinch a fold of skin at the injection site with one hand.
9c. Witha quick and âdart-likeâ motion, insert the Needle completely into the fold of the skin at a 45-defree angle (seeÂ Figure I).
Å¸Â Â Do not change the position of the Prefilled Syringe after the injection has started.
10a. After the Needle is inserted, release the pinched skin.
10b. Push the Plunger down slowly and as far as it will go until the Prefilled Syringe is empty (See Figure J).
Note: The Needle Guard will not activate unless all the Medicines is injected.

paragraph.content: 11. Remove the Prefilled Syringe from the injection site.

td.paragraph: 11a. After the Prefilled Syringe is empty, slowly lift your thumb from the Plunger until Needle is completely covered by the Neeld Guard (seeÂ Figure K).

list.item: Do notÂ reuse the Prefilled Syringe.
Do not touch the Needle.
Some bleeding may occur.
Do notÂ rub the injection site.

paragraph.content: 12. Throw away (dispose of) the Prefilled Syringe.

td.paragraph: 12a. Put the used Prefilled Syringe in an FDA-cleared sharps disposal container immediately after use (seeÂ Figure L).

list.item: Do not try to put the Cap back onto the Prefilled Syringe.
Do notÂ throw away (dispose of) the Prefilled Syringe in your household trash.
If you do not have an FDA-cleared sharps disposal container, you may use a household container that is:

td.paragraph:
- made of a heavy-duty plastic,
- able to closed with a tight-fitting, puncture-resistant lid, without sharps being able to come out,
- upright and stable during use,
- leak-resistant, and
- properly labeled to warn of hazardous waste inside the container.

list.item: When your sharps disposal container is almost full, you will need to follow your community guidelines for the right way to disposal of it. There may be state or local laws about how you should throw away used needles and syringes. For more information about safe sharps disposal, and for specific information about sharps disposal, and for specific information about sharps disposal in the state that you live in, go to the FDA's website at: http://www.fda.gov/safesharpsdisposal.
Do not dispose of your sharps disposal container in your household trash unless your community guidelines permit this. Do not recycle your used sharps disposal container.

td.paragraph: 13a. Treat the injection site by gently pressing a cotton ball or gauze to the site and apply an adhesive bandage, if necessary.
